item.title: 依靠绿色投资，中国的排放量或将在 2030 年开始下降
item.description: 据中国国际金融有限公司（China International Capital Corporation）称，如果中国能在未来五年内筹集到 17.5 万亿元人民币（约合 2.5 万亿美元）的绿色投资，那么到 2030 年，中国的排放量将减少 16 亿吨。【原文：China’s emissions could decline by 1.6 billion tons by 2030 if the country manages to mobilize 17.5 trillion yuan ($2.5 trillion) in green investments over the next five years, according to the China International Capital Corporation.】

item.title: 纽维恩计划投资 3.3 亿美元在澳大利亚开展太阳能电池项目，重点从美国转移
item.description: 美国资产管理公司 Nuveen LLC 计划明年斥资 5 亿澳元（约合 3.3 亿美元）在澳大利亚建设一个太阳能和电池项目，因为政治不确定性给美国清洁能源的前景蒙上了阴影。【原文：American asset manager Nuveen LLC plans to spend as much as A$500 million ($330 million) on a solar and battery project in Australia within the next year, as political uncertainty clouds the outlook for clean energy in the US.】

item.title: 中国的太阳能领军企业希望通过太阳能解决电网过剩问题
item.description: 中国的太阳能电池板第一大省计划加快发展其他可再生能源和电池储能技术，以继续推广清洁能源，同时应对中午电力过剩的问题。【原文：China’s top province for solar panels plans to accelerate the development of other renewables as well as battery storage, as it seeks to keep promoting clean energy while dealing with a glut of midday electricity.】

item.title: 美国绿色地产融资模式瞄准全球发展
item.description: 在美国，与房地产挂钩的融资市场目前价值约 180 亿美元。【原文：Property-linked finance, a market that in the US is currently worth about $18 billion, is being targeted for significant growth by groups looking to decarbonize commercial and residential real estate.】

item.title: 香港迎来 2018 年 "山竹 "以来破坏力最大的台风
item.description: 香港正面临着自2018年 "山竹 "以来最具破坏性的气旋，因为一个超强台风在绕过菲律宾后，正带着猛烈的狂风向这个金融中心袭来。【原文：Hong Kong is facing potentially the most damaging cyclone since Mangkhut in 2018, as a super typhoon tracks toward the financial hub with ferocious winds after skirting the Philippines.】

item.title: 美国驻巴西高级外交官计划在政治和贸易裂痕中访问亚马逊地区
item.description:
加布里埃尔-埃斯科瓦尔（Gabriel Escobar）将在贝伦举办 COP30 气候峰会前几周访问该市，讨论森林砍伐问题。【原文：

Gabriel Escobar will visit Belem to discuss deforestation, weeks before the city hosts the COP30 climate summit. 

】

item.title: Orsted Venture 赢得法院裁决，重启风电场工程
item.description: 美国一名法官裁定，Orsted A/S支持的罗德岛沿岸风电场项目可以在质疑特朗普政府对这一价值数十亿美元的项目下达停工令的诉讼期间恢复施工。【原文：An Orsted A/S-backed wind farm venture off the Rhode Island coast can resume construction during a lawsuit challenging the Trump administration’s stop-work order on the multibillion dollar project, a US judge ruled.】

item.title: OMV 首席执行官称可再生能源不会在短期内取代天然气在欧盟的地位
item.description: 据能源公司 OMV AG 称，由于向太阳能和风能过渡的时间比预测的要长，欧洲经济在未来几十年内将继续依赖进口天然气。【原文：Europe’s economy will continue to rely on imported natural gas for decades to come as the transition to solar and wind takes longer than forecast, according to energy company OMV AG.】

item.title: 风险投资人在中国学到了什么？绿色日报
item.description: 在清洁技术的各个领域，中国似乎都处于领先地位。这让一群风险投资人不禁要问，西方初创企业是否有办法突围。找出答案的最佳途径是什么？前往世界绿色科技经济的中心地带。我们获得了他们的第一手资料，作为今天的头条新闻。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读全文。【原文：China leads in seemingly every category of clean tech. That left a group of venture capitalists wondering if there was any way for Western startups to break through. The best way to find out? Take a trip to the heart of the world’s green tech economy. We got their firsthand account as today’s leading story. You can read a full version on Bloomberg.com.】

item.title: 污染最严重的国家正在修订其排放目标。这是否足够？
item.description: 减少温室气体排放的努力没有达到科学家们所说的为避免灾难性气候变化而必须采取的措施。本周在纽约召开的联合国大会上，各国是否会承诺更加积极地减少温室气体排放是一个亟待解决的问题。【原文：Efforts to cut greenhouse-gas emissions are falling short of what scientists say must be done to avoid catastrophic climate change. Whether countries will commit to more aggressive reductions is a pressing question for the United Nations General Assembly in New York this week.】

item.title: 低价、空地和凉爽天气推动北欧数据中心蓬勃发展
item.description: 由于凉爽的天气和较低的电价吸引了更多的大型项目北上，北欧的电力公司将从欧洲数据中心的蓬勃发展中获得巨大收益。【原文：Nordic power companies stand to win big from Europe’s data-center boom, as cool weather and lower power prices entice more mega-projects northward.】

item.title: 日产改造 ProPilot，与特斯拉驾驶辅助技术一较高下
item.description: 在新任首席执行官伊万-埃斯皮诺萨（Ivan Espinosa）的领导下，日产汽车公司（Nissan Motor Co.更新产品阵容是其中的关键部分，但赢回要求尖端技术的客户也同样重要。【原文：Nissan Motor Co. is on a mission under new Chief Executive Officer Ivan Espinosa to rebuild its business. Refreshing its lineup is a key part of that, but so is winning back customers who demand cutting-edge technology.】

item.title: 超强台风逼近香港，香港可能关闭机场
item.description: 超强台风 "拉加萨 "目前正在菲律宾东北海岸附近以强风肆虐，香港正考虑在周二关闭其国际机场。【原文：Hong Kong is considering shutting its international airport on Tuesday ahead of Super Typhoon Ragasa, which is currently churning off the northeast coast of the Philippines with strong winds.】

item.title: 桑托斯启动澳大利亚最肮脏的巴罗萨天然气项目
item.description: 桑托斯有限公司（Santos Ltd.）开始生产澳大利亚排放量最高的天然气项目之一，这将有助于加强向亚洲买家的运输，但也威胁到该国努力实现净零排放的气候目标。【原文：Santos Ltd. started production from one of Australia’s highest-emitting natural gas projects, which will help bolster shipments to buyers in Asia but also threaten climate goals as the country tries to move toward net zero emissions.】

item.title: 保时捷电动车的回落凸显德国汽车帝国的裂痕
item.description: 保时捷公司（Porsche AG）正在为电动汽车踩刹车，以纠正这一压低了豪华汽车制造商利润率、拖累了母公司大众汽车公司（Volkswagen AG）的昂贵战略。【原文：Porsche AG is hitting the brakes on electric vehicles, correcting an expensive strategy that’s depressed the luxury-car maker’s margins and is dragging down parent Volkswagen AG.】

item.title: 中国公路之旅揭示西方无法投资的资产清单
item.description: 清洁技术领域的风险资本家们开始大声说出他们早就猜到的事情：中国的主导地位使得西方国家的关键领域无法投资。【原文：Venture capitalists in clean tech are starting to say out loud what they’ve suspected for a while: China’s dominance has left key sectors in the West uninvestable.】

item.title: 澳大利亚对 2030 年可再生能源目标充满信心，但对之后的目标尚不确定
item.description: 澳大利亚气候变化部长克里斯-鲍文（Chris Bowen）表示，澳大利亚政府对到 2030 年实现可再生能源发电目标持乐观态度，但目前还不准备对 2030 年之后的情况做出预测。【原文：Australia’s government is optimistic it can achieve its renewable-generation target by 2030 but isn’t ready to make forecasts beyond that, according to Climate Change Minister Chris Bowen.】

item.title: 干旱笼罩美国东北部，纽约市引发秋季野火恐慌
item.description: 随着夏末干旱席卷美国东北部，新英格兰部分地区的水道和水井正在干涸，纽约市的树木已经开始落叶，野火的风险也随之上升。【原文：Waterways and wells are running dry in parts of New England and trees in New York City are already shedding their leaves as a late-summer drought engulfs the US Northeast, raising the risk of wildfires.】

item.description:
从各国新的气候承诺到卡拉OK之夜，这些都是不可错过的活动。【原文：

From countries’ new climate pledges to karaoke night, these are the must-catch events.

item.title: 各国批准首个保护海洋生物的全球条约
item.description:
新协议允许设立海洋保护区，并规定对可能破坏生物多样性的活动进行环境审查。【原文：

The new agreement allows for marine protection areas and mandates environmental review of activities that could damage biodiversity.

】

item.title: 太阳能制造商因金属价格飙升而放弃使用白银
item.description: 全球太阳能制造商是白银的最大工业消费者，在白银价格飙升的背景下，他们将在数年内首次减少贵金属的使用量。【原文：Global solar manufacturers, the largest industrial consumers of silver, are set to reduce use of the precious metal for the first time in years amid a scorching rally in its price.】

item.title: 特朗普正在以危险的速度瓦解气候科学
item.description: 白宫阻止了测量、应对和抗击全球变暖的努力。这将所有美国人置于危险之中。【原文：La Casa Blanca ha bloqueado los esfuerzos para medir, responder y combatir el calentamiento global. Eso pone en riesgo a todos los estadounidenses.】

item.title: 托运人警告净零计划到 2035 年可能耗资超过 3000 亿美元
item.description: 一些航运公司警告说，国际海事组织计划制定的净零规则有可能给航运业带来巨大成本。【原文：A group of shipping firms warned that the International Maritime Organization’s planned net zero rules risk imposing significant costs on the industry.】

item.title: 中国两大太阳能巨头结束法律之争，行业陷入困境
item.description: 隆基绿色能源科技股份有限公司（LONGI Green Energy Technology Co.【原文：LONGi Green Energy Technology Co. and Jinko Solar Co. have agreed to settle their patent lawsuits to help promote growth in an industry that has struggled with overcapacity and deep losses.】

item.title: 汽车制造商转向电动皮卡，尝试重新定义 "经济型 "皮卡
item.description: 去年美国最畅销的汽车是皮卡。第二名呢？也是皮卡。(记分的话，它们分别是福特 F 系列和 GMC Sierra）。【原文：The top-selling vehicle in the US last year was a pickup. Second place? Also a pickup. (They were the Ford F-Series and GMC Sierra respectively, for those keeping score.)】

item.title: Gresham House 在绿色基础设施交易中收购 SUSI Partners
item.description: 英国资产管理公司 Gresham House 同意收购总部位于瑞士的 SUSI Partners，作为拓展与能源转型相关的基础设施市场战略的一部分。【原文：UK asset manager Gresham House agreed to buy Switzerland-based SUSI Partners as part of a strategy to expand in the market for infrastructure tied to the energy transition.】

item.title: 小米将为约 40% 的 SU7 电动汽车部署辅助驾驶修复系统
item.description: 小米公司（Xiaomi Corp. ）将部署一个空中软件修复程序，以纠正其先进驾驶辅助技术的问题，该技术已安装在其销售的近 40% 的 SU7 电动轿车上。【原文：Xiaomi Corp. will deploy an over-the-air software fix to rectify a problem in its advanced driver assistance technology installed in almost 40% of the SU7 electric sedans it’s sold.】

item.title: 欧洲电动汽车制造商在爱沙尼亚稀土磁铁工厂排队等候
item.description: 欧洲电动汽车行业的高管们正跋山涉水来到欧洲大陆人口稀少的东北部地区，排队购买他们在中国以外的任何地方都很难找到的东西：电动汽车的重要部件稀土磁铁。【原文：Executives from Europe’s electric-vehicle industry are trekking to the continent’s sparsely populated northeastern parts to queue for something they struggle to find anywhere outside of China: rare-earths magnets that are essential components in EVs.】

item.title: 竞争对手觊觎金属，新加坡寻求非洲碳信用额度
item.description: 中国、印度和美国都想要非洲的重要矿产。新加坡的主要目标则不同：非洲大陆的碳抵消。【原文：China, India and the US want Africa’s critical minerals. Singapore’s main target is different: the continent’s carbon offsets.】

item.title: BNEF 未来之桶峰会的五大收获
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统、人工智能的崛起和全球电气化等几股关键力量迫使各能源领域的公司调整其可持续发展目标和投资重点。【原文：A few key forces — President Donald Trump, the rise of artificial intelligence and global electrification — have compelled companies across the energy spectrum to adjust their sustainability goals and investment priorities.】
